channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: The Puzzle of Sustainable Investment
item.description: Lukasz Pomorski adeptly discusses the good, the bad, and the unknown of sustainable investing while acknowledging that the answer to some of the criti...

item.title: A group of women lowered their biological age by an average of 5 years in just 8 weeks. Here’s how
item.description: Changes to diet, sleep, and exercise along with interventions like relaxation exercises and supplements—could reverse aging, according to research.

item.title: NC rallygoers 'praying' that Trump wins, slam Dem rhetoric calling him a 'threat' after assassination attempts
item.description: Rallygoers at former President Trump's Wilmington, North Carolina, rally told Fox News Digital why they are supporting the Republican nominee in 2024.

item.title: The Media Response to the Trump Assassination Attempts Is Not Normal
item.description: The press chooses victim-blaming and apathy.

item.title: Leftist ‘Voter Guide’ Group Pushes Its Way Into Universities
item.description: While the group claims its voter resources are 'nonpartisan,' the guides indicate a clear bias in favor of left-wing candidates.

item.title: Influencers overran a rural Vermont town. Now its locals are fighting back
item.description: During fall foliage season, hundreds of tourists flock to Pomfret, a small town of 900 locals.

item.title: 'Pretty damn significant': Slotkin suffers blow in Michigan as farm bureau jilts Dems to endorse GOP candidate
item.description: Former Rep. Mike Rogers beat out Rep. Elissa Slotkin to receive a coveted endorsement from the Michigan Farm Bureau's AgriPac.

item.title: The Nemesis of American Parents Is Kamala’s ‘Incredible Friend’
item.description: If elected president, Harris would side with Randi Weingarten and her union monopoly power against parents.

item.title: Election Integrity Advocates Can Inspect South Carolina Voter Rolls, Federal Judge Rules
item.description: The election integrity group will now be allowed access to voter roll data to ensure ineligible persons are not casting ballots.

item.title: Hinge CEO says he bribed students with KitKats to get the $400 million-a-year business off the ground
item.description: "We would get dozens of users a day—maybe, if that," Hinge CEO Justin McLeod tells Fortune.

item.title: Working class will come home to Harris, rallygoers in postindustrial Pennsylvania say

item.title: Nate Silver’s Latest Doesn’t Glitter
item.description: The impressive statistician presents some useful insights in his latest book, but it suffers from trying to do too much and lacking a unifying theme.

item.title: Trump rejects CNN debate against Harris, citing start of early voting
